Name: The historic homestead at Whariwharangi
Description: Stay in an historic homestead, which is now a DOC hut

Name: Camping
Description: Some people visit Abel Tasman National Park just for the camping! There are campsites dotted all along the track with some located right next to a beautiful golden beach!

Name: Cleopatras Pool
Description: Swim at Cleopatras Pool, a natural rock pool with a moss-lined waterslide that is fit for a queen! From Torrent Bay estuary, a 20 minute walk takes you to this refreshing pool.

Name: Onetahuti Beach
Description: Rest your weary walking feet at Onetahuti Beach. Shaped like a horse shoe itï¿½s one of the longest and most beautiful beaches in the park. Swim, snorkel or soak up the sunshine!

Name: Pitt Head
Description: A 20 min walk crosses a low ridge from Anchorage Hut to crescent-shaped Te Pukatea Bay. From there, a 1 hour walk with great views leads to Pitt Head, an old pa site, and back to Anchorage.

Name: Tonga Island Marine Reserve
Description: Tonga Island Marine Reserve is the third marine reserve to be created alongside a national park and covers an area of 1835 hectares. Swimming, snorkelling and kayaking are popular activities in the reserve.
